column2: Climate Neutrality (2040 target under discussion)
column5: The implementation of TA1.1, which aims to achieve climate neutrality by 2040, is likely to have a positive impact on TA5.2, as reducing greenhouse gas emissions will also lead to a reduction in antimicrobial use in farmed animals and aquaculture.

column2: Reduce of 55% GHG emissions compared to 1990 levels (2040 target under discussion)
column5: The reduction of GHG emissions as outlined in TA1.3 will contribute to the mitigation of climate change, which is also a key objective of TA5.7, thereby having a positive impact on this target.

column2: The contribution of the sectors covered by the EU ETS with respect to the EU Climate ambition should be of -62 % compared to 2005
column5: The increased ambition in GHG emission reductions from the EU ETS sectors as stated in TA1.9 will likely lead to a reduction in the use of more hazardous pesticides, aligning with the objectives of TA5.4.

column2: Renewable hydrogen will be key to replace natural gas, coal and oil in hard-to-decarbonise industries and transport
column5: The development and use of renewable hydrogen as outlined in TA2.1 could support the competitiveness of the EU supply sector, as mentioned in TA5.20, by providing a low-carbon alternative for industries.

column2: Set up at least one renewables-based energy community in every municipality with a population higher than 10.000
column5: The establishment of renewables-based energy communities as per TA2.2 could enhance access to fast broadband for all farmers and rural areas, supporting the objective of TA5.21.

column2: Member States shall endeavour to increase the share of energy from renewable sources and from waste heat and cold in district heating and cooling by an indicative 2,2 percentage points as an annual average calculated for the period 2021 to 2030
column5: Increasing the share of renewable energy in district heating and cooling, as proposed in TA2.14, could improve the availability of sustainable food by reducing the environmental impact of the food production and distribution process, aligning with TA5.29.

column2: the Unionâ€™s 2030 targets for energy and climate
column5: The energy and climate targets mentioned in TA2.17, including the reduction of GHG emissions, are directly related to the objectives of TA5.7, which aims to tackle climate change through mitigation and adaptation measures.

column2: Member States shall determine an indicative national share of renewable energy produced on-site or nearby as well as renewable energy taken from the grid in final energy consumption in their building sector in 2030
column5: The promotion of on-site and nearby renewable energy production for buildings, as outlined in TA2.18, could contribute to ensuring affordability and access to sufficient, nutritious, and sustainable food, as this reduces the energy costs for food production and processing, supporting the goals of TA5.30.

column2: All packaging shall be recyclable
column5: Making all packaging recyclable, as stated in TA3.5, will help reduce nutrient losses by minimizing waste and promoting sustainable practices in the food system, which is in line with the objectives of TA5.3.

column2: Reduce the generation of food waste in processing and manufacturing by 10% in comparison to the amount generated in 2020
column5: Reducing food waste in processing and manufacturing, as proposed in TA3.7, directly contributes to minimizing nutrient losses and supports the goal of TA5.3.

column2: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain the recycling targets of 65% by weight of all packaging waste generated by 31 December 2025
column5: Increasing packaging waste recycling, as outlined in TA3.9, can help ensure the availability of sustainable food by reducing waste and promoting a circular economy in the food system, supporting the objectives of TA5.29.

column2: Alternative fuels infrastructure
column5: The development of alternative fuels infrastructure, as mentioned in TA4.2, can support the creation of shorter supply chains, reducing dependence on long-haul transportation and aligning with the goals of TA5.22.

column2: Member States shall set an obligation on fuel suppliers to ensure that the amount of renewable fuels and renewable electricity supplied to the transport sector leads to a share of renewable energy within the final consumption of energy in the transport sector of at least 29 % by 2030
column5: The increase in renewable energy in the transport sector, as proposed in TA4.13, will contribute to the reduction of GHG emissions and help tackle climate change, supporting the objectives of TA5.7.

column2: Reduce overall EU sales of antimicrobials for farmed animals and in aquaculture by 50% by 2030
column5: The reduction of antimicrobial sales, as outlined in TA5.2, might have a negative impact on TA1.1, as it could lead to increased disease susceptibility in livestock, potentially hindering the progress towards climate neutrality.

column2: Reduce nutrient losses by at least 50%, while ensuring no deterioration on soil fertility
column5: The focus on reducing nutrient losses as stated in TA5.3 might divert attention from the primary goal of reducing GHG emissions as outlined in TA1.9, potentially slowing progress towards the EU's climate ambition.

column2: Tackle climate change: climate change adaptation and mitigation
column5: The efforts to tackle climate change, as mentioned in TA5.7, will likely support the development and use of renewable hydrogen, as outlined in TA2.1, by creating a demand for low-carbon energy solutions.

column2: Foster the competitiveness of the EU supply sector
column5: Fostering the competitiveness of the EU supply sector, as stated in TA5.20, could be supported by the establishment of renewables-based energy communities, as proposed in TA2.2, by promoting local energy production and consumption.

column2: Ensure access to fast broadband to all farmers and all rural areas
column5: Ensuring access to fast broadband, as outlined in TA5.21, could facilitate the adoption of renewable energy solutions in district heating and cooling, supporting the objectives of TA2.14.

column2: Create shorter supply chains will support reducing dependence on long-haul transportation
column5: The creation of shorter supply chains, as mentioned in TA5.22, could be facilitated by the development of alternative fuels infrastructure, as proposed in TA4.2, reducing transportation needs and emissions.

column2: Improve availability of sustainable food
column5: Improving the availability of sustainable food, as stated in TA5.29, could be supported by making all packaging recyclable, as outlined in TA3.5, reducing waste and promoting sustainable food systems.

column2: Ensure affordability and access to sufficient, nutritious and sustainable food
column5: Ensuring affordability and access to sustainable food, as mentioned in TA5.30, could be supported by promoting on-site and nearby renewable energy production for buildings, as outlined in TA2.18, reducing energy costs for food production and processing.

column2: Legally protect a minimum of 30% of the EU's land area
column5: Protecting a significant portion of the EU's land area, as stated in TA6.1, will help in tackling climate change by preserving carbon sinks and promoting biodiversity, supporting the objectives of TA5.7.

column2: At least 10% of agricultural area is under high-diversity landscape features
column5: Promoting high-diversity landscape features in agricultural areas, as mentioned in TA6.10, can help reduce nutrient losses and improve soil fertility, aligning with the goals of TA5.3.

column2: Three billion trees are planted in the EU, in full respect of ecological principles
column5: The large-scale planting of trees, as outlined in TA6.11, could support the development of renewable hydrogen production, as mentioned in TA2.1, by providing biomass feedstocks.

column2: Improve air quality to reduce the number of premature deaths caused by air pollution by 55% by 2030
column5: Improving air quality, as stated in TA7.1, will contribute to reducing the health impacts of air pollution, which is also a consideration in achieving the EU's climate ambition, as outlined in TA1.9.

column2: Improve water quality by reducing waste, plastic litter at sea (by 50%) and microplastics released into the environment (by 30%), by 2030
column5: The efforts to improve water quality, as mentioned in TA7.2, will support the overall goal of reducing pollution and promoting sustainable development, which is also crucial for tackling climate change, as outlined in TA5.7.

column2: Improve soil quality by reducing nutrient losses and chemical pesticides' use by 50%, by 2030
column5: The focus on improving soil quality, as stated in TA7.3, will directly contribute to reducing nutrient losses and promoting sustainable agriculture practices, supporting the objectives of TA5.3.

column2: Reduce by 25% the EU ecosystems where air pollution threatens biodiversity, by 2030
column5: The reduction of air pollution's impact on biodiversity, as outlined in TA7.4, will support the protection of the EU's land area and the promotion of biodiversity, aligning with the goals of TA6.1.
